commit.message:
Released version 0.7.4

Allow futex system call in sandbox.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Add futex system call

Requirement noticed by Mohamed-Fathy-Salah.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Merged JPEG undefined behaviour fix into PNG

Since PNG uses longjmp as well, the fixes of load_jpeg must be
applied here, too.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Bumped copyright year

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Avoid explicit copy operations

This allows the compiler to optimize the code, which results
in less machine instructions on my amd64 system.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Fixed help message

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Removed unused variables

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Released version 0.7.3

Daemon mode releases resources now also if it is shut down by
another X client.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Clean up resources in daemon mode

Use a second X connection for clean up tasks in case the xwallpaper
daemon is shut down by another X client.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Released version 0.7.2

Fix resource handling of atom pixmaps.
Reported by and (hopefully) resolved with stharward on github.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Kill resources, not clients

The atom handling is a bit more complicated than expected. If --clear is
not specified, we do want to re-use atoms. This in turn means that we
will not create a new pixmap, which in turn means that we have no
resources which should retain.

We do want to retain pixmaps permanently if they are created and used in
atoms.

This in turn means that daemon mode is a bit more complicated. We do
want to re-use pixmaps of other programs (or xwallpaper instances) if we
can re-use them. This is not true anymore if the resolution of the
screen changed.

The simplicity of xwallpaper suffered greatly with separated root window
and atom handling as well as the daemon mode. This code is prone for
some refactoring.

For now it has to withstand further testing to see if my understanding
of pixmap handling in root windows and atoms is correct and if this in
turn resulted in a proper implementation.

Reported by and resolved with stharward on github.

Please note:

We still have an issue if daemon mode gets interrupted by another
wallpaper setter or by xwallpaper --clean. The allocated pixmap is
permanently retained and will not be cleaned up if the daemon xwallpaper
has not been explicitly killed before.

Since this sounds like an uncommon setup, I delay the fix. It might
involve adjusting the stage 2 sandbox, so I am willing to accept this
corner case -- documented in manual page.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Always kill temporary atom clients

Otherwise resources in X server are not always cleaned up.
This can lead to client connection exhaustion on server side.

Reported by and resolved with stharward on github.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Released version 0.7.1

Extended sandbox to support more Linux setups (Gentoo setup triggered an
issue).

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Keep alphabetical ordering

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

commit.message: added fstatat64 sys call

Allow statx system call.

It is safe enough to be included and triggers an issue with Gentoo
if omitted.

Reported here: https://github.com/stoeckmann/xwallpaper/issues/35

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Released version 0.7.0

Added missing --focus option to zsh auto completion. Added new
options --clear, --no-atoms, and --no-root for better handling
of different aspects of the X window system.

Changed default to "retain" wallpapers of outputs which are not
explicitly set by xwallpaper. Up to this release, the outputs
were set to black. Now, they are retrieved from atoms.

Keep old behavior by specifying --clear.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Do not query atoms with --no-atoms.

The option --no-atoms implies that pixmap used by atoms is not
changed. But if X root window is updated with queried pixmap, it
is modified later on.

Automatically activate --clear if --no-atoms is specified.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Retain reused pixmaps.

If xwallpaper reuses an atom pixmap of a previous program, then
do not kill its data.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Improved atom handling.

Atoms are used in xwallpaper to support pseudo transparency. Until now
it has been set to the same pixmap as drawn to root window.

Not every setup requires support for pseudo transparency. In fact it is
probably only used by terminal emulators which retrieve background
through this feature.

Now it is even possible to update the background used for pseudo
transparency independently from actual wallpaper. You can use this to
improve pseudo transparency for clients which do not support image
manipulation. Example would be to create a second image which is
darker than the first one. A terminal emulator which cannot reduce
brightness on its own would profit from this.

By default xwallpaper will try to retrieve the background from pseudo
transparency atoms. To stay with old behavior, always use --clear.

Switching xwallpaper behavior for scenarios in which not all outputs are
specified is a "corner case". It led to confusion in the past. Although
the whole X background setup is confusing, xwallpaper should try to
behave as (intuitively) expected.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Release resources after usage.

The daemon mode would eventually use up all memory in X server
because it does not release replaced pixmaps in atoms. Oops.

Also free gc after use.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

commit.message:
Added --focus to _xwallpaper

Signed-off-by: Khue Nguyen <Z5483Y@gmail.com>

Released version 0.6.6

Fixes compatibility with Linux distributions regarding
configuration, building, and runtime behaviour.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Add newfstatat to white list.

The newfstatat system call is used in glibc 2.33 during normal
operation. This fixes a core dump (which is expected behaviour when an
illegal system call is performed) spotted and reported by abbasmaheryar
on github.

Applied suggested fix by collidedscope on github as well.

See issue #28 for more details.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Bump copyright year.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Directly set LIBS for workaround.

Since JPEG_LIB is never used, directly set LIBS. The whole subjet
has been pointed out and greatly analyzed by Breno Lipi, thanks!

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Fix configure for Ubuntu LTS distributions.

Their pc files do not contain a version. Fallback to a header and
lib approach. Rather minimimalistic macro setup, I am not into
adding more into this.

Please setup your pc files in case of issues.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>

Tell fopen that we process binary files.

This is ignored on POSIX systems but might come in handy on
systems which treat text and binary files differently.

Signed-off-by: Tobias Stoeckmann <tobias@stoeckmann.org>
